2: Tactical Cloak does not consume tech points, at the cost of your sneak attack die type being reduced to d4
6: Uncanny Dodge -- When an attacker that you can see hits you with an attack, you can use your reaction to halve the attack's damage against you.

18: Advance <button type="button" class="link" data-id="Shadow Strike" data-key="power" data-type="spells" data-toggle="modal" data-target="#ajaxModal">Shadow Strike</button>

2: Shadow Broker - You are an operative of the Shadow Broker and your focus is on people and on the influence and secrets they have. Many spies, courtiers, and schemers follow this archetype, leading lives of intrigue. Words are your weapons as often as guns or powers, and secrets and favors are some of your favorite treasures. This information may give you detailed information about a scheme or plot, call in favors, blackmail other characters. Tactically, it might give you access to security cameras, preventing surprise attacks or giving you access to security profiles and learning about enemies you might fight.
6: Eye for Detail - You can use the bonus action granted by your Cunning Action feature to make a Wisdom (Perception) check to spot a hidden creature or object, to make an Intelligence (Investigation) check to uncover and decipher clues, or to use Insightful Fighting. -- Insightful Fighting - You gain the ability to decipher an opponent's tactics and develop a counter to them. As an action (or as a bonus action using Eye for Detail), you make a Wisdom (Insight) check against a creature you can see that isn't incapacitated, opposed by the target's Charisma (Deception) check. If you succeed, you can add your Sneak Attach damage to your next successfull melee or ranged attack without having to come out of Tactical Cloak. This benefit lasts for 1 minute or until you successfully use Insightful Fighting against a different target.
10: Learn <button type="button" class="link" data-id="Electric Slash" data-key="power" data-type="spells" data-toggle="modal" data-target="#ajaxModal">Electric Slash</button>
14: Infiltration - You can unfailingly create false identities for yourself. You can't establish an identity that belongs to someone else. For example, you might establish yourself within mercernary gang to gain access to their supplies or armory, or a rich colonist to gain access to a fancy party. Thereafter, if you adopt the new identity as a disguise, other creatures believe you to be that person until given an obvious reason not to. If you do not have the appropriate time to research an identity, you will at least gain advantage on pursuation rolls.
18: Advance <button type="button" class="link" data-id="Electric Slash" data-key="power" data-type="spells" data-toggle="modal" data-target="#ajaxModal">Electric Slash</button>

2: Master Tactician - You can use the Help action as a bonus action. Additionally, when you use the Help action to aid an ally in attacking a creature, the target of that attack can be within 30 feet of you, rather than 5 feet of you, if the target can see or hear you.
6: Misdirection - you can sometimes cause another creature to suffer an attack meant for you. When you are targeted by an attack while a creature within 5 feet of you is granting you cover against that attack, you can use your reaction to have the attack target that creature instead of you.
10: Learn <button type="button" class="link" data-id="Repair Matrix" data-key="power" data-type="spells" data-toggle="modal" data-target="#ajaxModal">Repair Matrix</button>
14: Master Deulist - Your mastery of combat lets you turn failure to success in combat. If you miss with an attack roll, you can choose to roll it again with advantage. Once you do so, you can't use this feature again until you finish a short or long rest.
18: Advance <button type="button" class="link" data-id="Repair Matrix" data-key="power" data-type="spells" data-toggle="modal" data-target="#ajaxModal">Repair Matrix</button>
